lessons.title: Example: use()
lessons.interactiveContent:
Fill in the gaps to use app.use correctly.

Make sure to type app.use.

lessons.title: Router in Files - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a new instance of the Express router.

Make sure to pick express followed by . and then Router, (, ).

lessons.title: Question: Custom Middleware
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's missing in the code for this custom middleware function to run?

It's missing app.use(logMethod)It's missing const useMiddleware = require(logMethod)It's missing app.set(logMethod)

It's missing app.use(logMethod).

lessons.title: Question: App Level
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of the following is true about app-level middleware?

App-level middleware functions execute whenever a request is sent to the applicationApp-level middleware is not commonly used in Expressrouter.use() is an example of an app level middleware

App-level middleware functions execute whenever a request is sent to the application.

lessons.title: Question: next()
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's wrong with this code that'll prevent the app.get from executing?

We're not calling next inside of app.use callback functionWe're not calling next inside of app.get callback functionThere's nothing wrong with the codeWe're not passing next as a parameter to the app.use callback function

We're not calling next inside of app.use callback function.

lessons.title: Exercise: next()
lessons.interactiveContent:
Call the correct function to proceed to the next middleware function.

Make sure to type next().

lessons.title: Exercise: Built-in Middleware
lessons.interactiveContent:
Finish the code to run the express.json built-in middleware.

Make sure to pick app followed by . and then use, express.json, ().

lessons.title: Example: router.METHOD()
lessons.interactiveContent:
Finish the code for the GET method on the router object, not on the app object.

Make sure to type router.get.

lessons.title: Question: router.param()
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does the router.param method match?

Any route that uses the specified parameterAny route that does not use the specified parameterAll GET requests with the specified parameter

Any route that uses the specified parameter.

lessons.title: router.route()
lessons.interactiveContent:
Ensure we validate authentication for all routes the router is handling by using the custom middleware validateAuth for all routes..

Make sure to pick all, followed by validateAuth.

lessons.title: Question: router.param()
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the main purpose of the router.param method in Express Router?

To define middleware functions that will be executed when a request is made to a path with a specified parameterTo ignore incoming requests with certain parameters

To define middleware functions that will be executed when a request is made to a path with a specified parameter.

lessons.title: Example: router.param()
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the parameters of router.param to print the country whenever a parameter with the name country is used.

Make sure to type country.

lessons.title: Question: Custom Middleware
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is missing in the code for this custom middleware function to run?

It's missing app.use(logMethod)It's missing const useMiddleware = require(logMethod)It's missing app.do(logMethod)

It's missing app.use(logMethod).

lessons.title: Example: use()
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the method that mounts the middleware function to the "/students" path.

Make sure to type use.

lessons.title: Question: app.use()
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's the purpose of the app.use method?

It mounts the middleware pagesRouter to the path /pagesIt mounts the middleware pagesRouter to the entire applicationIt mounts the middleware pagesRouter to the path /

It mounts the middleware pagesRouter to the path /pages.

lessons.title: router.use() - 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the app use the router for the "/library" route.

Make sure to pick app followed by . and then use, router.

lessons.title: Example: Initial setup
lessons.interactiveContent:
Import blogs.js using the require function and store it in a meaningful variable.

Make sure to pick blogsRouter, followed by require, and finally "./blogs.js".

lessons.title: Lesson #6 - Copy - Copy - Copy - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code to capture route parameters with the router.

Make sure to type param.

lessons.title: next()
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make sure the middleware function doesn't stop the request's journey.

Make sure to type next.

lessons.title: Lesson #16
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of the following status codes indicates a permanent redirect?

301302

Make sure to pick 301.

lessons.title: Question: router.use()
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is necessary to run the middleware functions mounted on the path by router.use?

That the requested path base matches the pathThat there is only one middleware function used by the router objectThat there is more than one middleware function used by the router object

That the requested path base matches the path.

lessons.title: Import Modules
lessons.interactiveContent:
Import the router from the router.js file.

Make sure to pick require, followed by "./router.js".

lessons.title: Lesson #13
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does router.use(express.json()) do?

It sets up middleware for the routerIt sets up middleware for the app

It sets up middleware for the router.

lessons.title: Question: router.route()
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does the method router.route allow us to do?

It allows us to handle all HTTP methods for a single route with one functionIt returns an instance of the router object

It allows us to handle all HTTP methods for a single route with one function.

lessons.title: daf - Copy - Copy - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Pass the custom middleware functions in an array to the router and ensure they are run when the route "/game" is captured.

Make sure to pick router.use followed by "/game" and then [, ,, ].

lessons.title: Lesson #7 - Copy - Copy - Copy - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Ensure the router executes the middleware for every route it matches.

Make sure to type all.

lessons.title: Export Modules
lessons.interactiveContent:
Export router from the users.js file.

Make sure to pick module, followed by .exports, and finally router.

lessons.title: Example: router.use()
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code with the parameters for router.use.

Make sure to pick req,, followed by res,, and finally next.

lessons.title: Exercise: Built-in Middleware
lessons.interactiveContent:
Include the built-in middleware function that parses the request body's JSON payload.

Make sure to pick express followed by . and then json, (, ).

lessons.title: Lesson #2 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Ensure the request continues to propagate.

Make sure to type next.

lessons.title: App Level Middleware
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use the custom logging middleware globally.

Make sure to type app.use.

lessons.title: Lesson #14 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Mount the router so that all its routes are prefixed with a specific path, allowing for organized grouping of related endpoints.

Make sure to pick "/user", followed by ,, and finally router.

lessons.title: GET Endpoint - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a PATCH endpoint using the router.

Make sure to pick router, followed by ., and finally patch.

lessons.title: Question: router.use()
lessons.interactiveContent:
The main purpose of the method router.use is to mount middleware functions to a specific path.

TrueFalse

Make sure to pick True.

lessons.title: app.use() - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code to use the imported routes from users.js.

Make sure to pick usersRouter followed by "./users.js" and then app, ., use, usersRouter.

lessons.title: Lesson #4 - Copy - Copy - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the app utilize the userRoutes router.

Make sure to type app.use.

lessons.title: router.param()
lessons.interactiveContent:
Bind middleware to a specified parameter clothingId.

Make sure to pick router, followed by ., and finally param.

lessons.title: Lesson #6 - Copy - Copy - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Capture the route parameter car using the router.

Make sure to type "car".

lessons.title: Question: Express Router
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does Express router do?

It helps you organize and manage routes modularly in your Express applicationIt connects your app directly to the database for data operations

It helps you organize and manage routes modularly in your Express application.

lessons.title: Question: Router in Files
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use the appropriate Express method to generate a router object, and assign it to the router variable.

Make sure to type express.Router().
